==formula one racing==
+
==Formula 1 racing==
2011's [[Formula 1]] race was called off due to the civil unrest. But Bahrain's troubles seem to be persisting still, with violence near the now-famous Pearl Square marking the parliamentary elections at the weekend. According to veteran Swiss correspondent Roger Benoit, writing in the ''Blick'' newspaper, Turkey has been put on standby should Bahrain's late April event be called off in 2012.<ref>[http://formula-one.speedtv.com/article/f1-turkey-on-standby-for-2012-bahrain-axe-report/ F1: Turkey On Standby For 2012 Bahrain Axe - Report] -''[[Speed (TV channel)|Speed TV]]''.</ref>
2011's [[Formula 1]] race was called off due to the civil unrest. But Bahrain's troubles seem to be persisting still, with violence near the now-famous Pearl Square marking the parliamentary elections at the weekend. According to veteran Swiss correspondent Roger Benoit, writing in the ''Blick'' newspaper, Turkey has been put on standby should Bahrain's late April event be called off in 2012.<ref>[http://formula-one.speedtv.com/article/f1-turkey-on-standby-for-2012-bahrain-axe-report/ F1: Turkey On Standby For 2012 Bahrain Axe - Report] -''[[Speed (TV channel)|Speed TV]]''.</ref>
